hadiths.text: The believer who mixes with people and bears their annoyance with patience will have a greater reward than the believer who does not mix with people and does not put up with their annoyance.
None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.
The strong person is not the one who can wrestle someone else down. The strong person is the one who can control himself when he is angry.
Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should speak good or keep silent.
The best of people are those who benefit others.
A good word is charity.
Be in this world as if you were a stranger or a traveler along a path.
The world is green and beautiful, and Allah has appointed you as His stewards over it.
Whoever removes a worldly grief from a believer, Allah will remove from him one of the griefs of the Day of Judgment.
The most beloved deeds to Allah are those that are most consistent, even if they are few.
Whoever is not merciful to others, will not be treated mercifully.
A man is upon the religion of his friend, so let one of you look at whom he befriends.
The best jihad is a word of truth spoken before a tyrannical ruler.
Actions are but by intention and every man shall have only that which he intended.
The believers in their mutual kindness, compassion, and sympathy are just one body; when a limb suffers, the whole body responds to it with wakefulness and fever.
Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should honor his guest.
The Muslim is the one from whose tongue and hand the Muslims are safe.
Remember often the destroyer of pleasures: death.
Every act of kindness is charity.
Allah does not look at your forms and possessions, but He looks at your hearts and your deeds.
The most perfect of believers in faith are those who are best in character.
Whoever conceals the faults of a Muslim, Allah will conceal his faults in this world and the Hereafter.
Make things easy and do not make them difficult, cheer the people up by conveying glad tidings to them and do not repulse them.
Verily, Allah is gentle and loves gentleness in all matters.
The Prophet said: 'Religion is very easy and whoever overburdens himself in his religion will not be able to continue in that way.'
Seek knowledge from the cradle to the grave.
The best richness is the richness of the soul.
He who sleeps with a full stomach while his neighbor goes hungry is not one of us.
When you see a person who has been given more than you in money and beauty, look to those who have been given less.
Allah has written down the very portion of adultery which a man will indulge in. There will be no escape from it.
Paradise lies at the feet of your mother.
Do not waste water even if performing ablution on the bank of a fast-flowing river.
The upper hand is better than the lower hand.
Allah will not be merciful to those who are not merciful to people.
The best of companions with Allah is the one who is best to his companions.
No one eats better food than that which he eats out of the work of his hand.
If Allah wants to do good to somebody, He afflicts him with trials.
The parable of the believers in their affection, mercy, and compassion for each other is that of a body. When any limb aches, the whole body reacts to it with sleeplessness and fever.
Whoever Allah wishes good for, He gives him understanding of the religion.
The best of houses is the house where an orphan gets love and kindness.
All the sons of Adam are sinners, but the best of sinners are those who repent.
Whoever travels a path in search of knowledge, Allah will make easy for him a path to Paradise.
The world is a prison for the believer and paradise for the disbeliever.
Indeed, after hardship comes ease.
Whoever shows mercy to people, Allah will show mercy to him.
The believer is not one who eats his fill while his neighbor goes hungry.
Smiling in the face of your brother is charity.
The best people are those who live longest and excel in their deeds.

Take benefit of five before five: your youth before your old age, your health before your sickness, your wealth before your poverty, your free time before you are occupied, and your life before your death.

What a wonderful blessing for the believer that all of his affairs are good for him. If something good happens to him, he is grateful, and that is good for him. If something bad happens to him, he bears it with patience, and that is good for him.
